content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
--------------------
### Extraction System Interface at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– An extraction system burner inserter located at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with a drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x≈2.5, y≈17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– A factory burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
– A secondary burner inserter inferred at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (as evidenced by neighbour links)
– An assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) responsible for copper-cable production

### Depot Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot
– A transport belt segment positioned at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
– A depot burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP) whose pickup position aligns with the depot target

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– A boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– An offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)
Used to generate electricity; note that warnings indicate connectivity and input issues

ERROR TIPS
----------
• Transport Belt Connection Errors:
  – When attempting to connect transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter entity. Avoid using or misidentifying Prototype.SteamEngine objects as targets by ensuring an appropriate inserter is in place before initiating the belt connection.

• Wooden Chest Placement Issues:
  – If an error indicates that the target position is too far (e.g. distance exceeds the maximum allowed), move the player closer to the intended placement position.
  – Before placing a wooden chest, verify that the inventory contains the required item to avoid placement failure.

• Undefined Variable Error:
  – Ensure that variable names (such as ‘target_chest’) are correctly defined and used consistently throughout the code to prevent NameError exceptions.
